intro: Fimbriella × keenanii, commonly known as the hybrid sea holly, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its distinctive blue or purple ray florets and a central disk of yellow tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to saline environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and slightly lobed, with a rough texture. Fimbriella × keenanii is often found in sandy or gravelly soils along the shoreline.
